snippet: The Supreme Court of India on Monday temporarily stayed the execution of two men convicted of raping and murdering a 23-year-old woman on a bus in New Delhi in 2012, said their lawyer, A. P. Singh, in a case that drew international attention,...
abstract: Supreme Court of India temporarily stays execution of two men convicted of raping and murdering 23-year-old woman on a bus in New Delhi in 2012; case drew international attention, prompted outcry in the country and led to strengthening of sexual assault laws.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court of India on Monday temporarily stayed the execution of two men convicted of raping and murdering a 23-year-old woman on a bus in New Delhi in 2012, said their lawyer, A. P. Singh, in a case that drew international attention, prompted an outcry in India and led to the strengthening of sexual assault laws in the country.

headline.main: India: Court Stays Executions for 2 Convicted in Gang-Rape Case
headline.print_headline: India: Court Stays Executions for 2 Convicted in Gang-Rape Case
